required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome of Radiation Therapy in Operated Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Outcome of Radiation Therapy In Operated Gastric Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
- Study tolerability and toxicity of radiotherapy with or without chemotherapy for operated gastric cancer.
- Evaluate the efficacy of adjuvant radiotherapy with or without chemotherapy as regarding local control and overall survival.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Radiotherapy in operated gastric cancer

intervention.description: Adjuvant Radiotherapy in operated gastric cancer

study_pop.textblock: Age of the patient; ≥18 and ≤75 years. Histologically proven gastric or gastroesophageal adenocarcinoma. Pt received adjuvant Radiotherapy with or without chemotherapy with any protocol.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age of the patient; ≥18 and ≤75 years.
- Histologically proven gastric or gastroesophageal adenocarcinoma.
- Pt received adjuvant Radiotherapy with or without chemotherapy with any protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient >75 years&<18 years.
- Histologically types other than adenocarcinoma .
- Metastatic patients (M1).
- Pt didn't recive radiotherapy.
